summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) discussing the initiation of a New York investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. It mentions the FBI NY office accessing files from the Florida case, identifying New York victims, and coordinating with the FBI Palm Beach office, while noting complications from the prior Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Recipient of the email discussing the initiation of the New York investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and the coordination with FBI offices.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is coordinating with the FBI NY office on the Epstein investigation, as indicated by the email discussing joint planning and case initiation.

events.title: Initiation of NY Epstein Investigation
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and FBI NY begin investigating Jeffrey Epstein, accessing electronic files from the Florida case and identifying New York victims.

keyFacts: The FBI NY office is opening an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and has accessed electronic files from the FBI Palm Beach office.
At least three identified New York victims were found in the initial review of files, including one who helped recruit other victims.
The 'scheduler' for Epstein, who received protection under the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA), often worked from New York.
The FBI is concerned about the NPA complicating the investigation and wants to ensure it won't be a hurdle before interviewing victims.
The FBI Palm Beach office is reportedly not resistant to the New York office pursuing the case.
